item.title: LSCOLORS
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: BSD ls and GNU ls differ on how to configure colors. Mac OS X ls is the BSD variant. The LSCOLORS Generator is helpful for creating a color set, or converting between BSD and GNU color configurations. I’m currently using: BSD: GxFxCxDxbxegedabagaced GNU: di=1;36;40:ln=1;35;40:so=1;32;40:pi=1;33;40:ex=31;40:bd=34;46:cd=34;43:su=0;41:sg=0;46:tw=0;42:ow=34;43:
item.content:encoded:
BSD ls and GNU ls differ on how to configure colors. Mac OS X ls is the BSD variant.

The LSCOLORS Generator is helpful for creating a color set, or converting between BSD and GNU color configurations.

I’m currently using:

  • BSD: GxFxCxDxbxegedabagaced
  • GNU: di=1;36;40:ln=1;35;40:so=1;32;40:pi=1;33;40:ex=31;40:bd=34;46:cd=34;43:su=0;41:sg=0;46:tw=0;42:ow=34;43:
